back.text:
Root: — (particle & pronoun)
Meaning: Indeed, We
Pronunciation: Innā
Tajweed Rules: Ghunna on the doubled نّ and Madd Ṭabīʿī on نَا (2 counts).
Derived Words: As a particle/pronoun it has no derived forms.
Example Ayah: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ شَاهِدًا وَمُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا

hint.text: The opening word of the Sūrah, a powerful declaration.

back.text:
Root: ع ط و (`-Ṭ-W)
Meaning: We have given you
Pronunciation: Aʿṭaynāka
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm (heaviness) on ط; Madd Ṭabīʿī on نَا (2 counts).
Derived Words:
1. عَطَاء (`Aṭāʾ): A gift
2. إِعْطَاء (Iʿṭāʾ): Giving
3. عَاطِي (`Āṭī): One who gives
Example Ayah: أَعْطَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلْقَهُ ثُمَّ هَدَىٰ

hint.text: A reference to a great gift from Allah.

back.text:
Root: ك ث ر (K-TH-R)
Meaning: The abundance
Pronunciation: Al-Kawthar
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah (clear lām).
Derived Words:
1. كَثْرَة (Kathrah): Multitude
2. أَكْثَر (Akthar): More
3. تَكْثِير (Takthīr): Making abundant
Example Ayah: This noun is unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: The name of the river in Paradise.

back.text:
Root: ص ل و (Ṣ-L-W)
Meaning: So pray
Pronunciation: Faṣalli
Tajweed Rules: Istiʿlā on Ṣād and Shaddah on لّ.
Derived Words:
1. صَلَاة (Ṣalāh): Prayer
2. مُصَلِّي (Muṣallī): One who prays
Example Ayah: وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ

Root: ن ح ر (N-Ḥ-R)
Meaning: And sacrifice
Pronunciation: Wanḥar
Tajweed Rules: Iẓhār of the nūn sākin before ḥāʾ.
Derived Words:
1. نَحْر (Naḥr): Sacrifice/slaughter
2. مَنْحَر (Manḥar): Place of sacrifice
Example Ayah: This verb form is unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: A command to perform a ritual sacrifice.

back.text:
Root: ش ن أ (Sh-N-ʾ)
Meaning: Your enemy, your hater
Pronunciation: Shāniʾaka
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on شَا.
Derived Words:
1. شَنَآن (Shanʾān): Hatred
2. شَنَأَ (Shanaʾa): He hated
Example Ayah: وَلَا يَجْرِمَنَّكُمْ شَنَآنُ قَوْمٍ

hint.text: Refers to the one who hated the Prophet ﷺ.

back.text:
Root: ب ت ر (B-T-R)
Meaning: The one cut off, without posterity
Pronunciation: Al-Abtar
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah (clear lām); Qalqalah on ب when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. بَتْر (Batr): Cutting off
Example Ayah: This noun is unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: A description of the Prophet’s enemy as cut off from legacy.
